org.jpws.front

Class ActionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.front.ActionHandler

  • public class ActionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Static singleton class organising actions, mainly depending on the command menus, and action related assisting routines. This class manages the system's idle time counter.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int OP_PASSMODIFIED

      • confirmOperation

        public static void confirmOperation(java.awt.Component owner,
                                    int operation,
                                    java.lang.String txt)
        Issues a confirming message to the user about the performance of a specific operation. (Currently only "OP_SENDCLIPBOARD".)
        Parameters:
        operation - kind of operation performed
        txt - text or text token substituted for the "$action" variable of the message text; may be null

      • clipboardUpdated

        public static void clipboardUpdated()
        Update the "Clear Clipboard" menuitem according to content.

      • registerChangeableObject

        public static void registerChangeableObject(java.lang.Object c)
        ActionHandler harbours a ChangeListener which resets the idle-time counter on text changes. This method adds changeable objects of the following types to this listener:

        AbstractButton, JTabbedPane JComboBox, JTextComponent

        Registering does not need a counterpart.

      • sendClipboardPassword

        public static boolean sendClipboardPassword(java.awt.Component owner,
                                            org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord record,
                                            boolean update)
        Send the password string of the specified record to the clipboard. If the value is empty, the clipboard is cleared. This updates the ACCESSTIME field of the record to the current time (conditional).
        Parameters:
        owner - Component the owner window or null
        record - PwsRecord
        update - boolean if true the record's ACCESSTIME value will get updated
        Returns:
        true if and only if a value was copied

      • sendClipboardText

        public static void sendClipboardText(java.awt.Component owner,
                                     java.lang.String text,
                                     java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a parameter text to the clipboard. Optionally a confirm message can be defined (which is shown if the global option "confirmCopyClipboard" is set true).
        Parameters:
        owner - Component the owner window or null
        text - String the text to be sent to clipboard
        msg - String text or token for naming the send object in confirm message; may be null

      • sendClipboardUsername

        public static void sendClipboardUsername(java.awt.Component owner,
                                         org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord record)
        Send the username string of the specified record to the clipboard. If the value is empty, the clipboard is cleared.
        Parameters:
        owner - Component the owner window or null
        record - PwsRecord

        Starts any Runnable task in a separate, new thread.
        Parameters:
        run - Runnable task
        Returns:
        Thread started thread which is active (or has run)

        Starts any Runnable task in the pool of worker threads.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Starts any Callable task in the pool of worker threads.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Future handle to control the task

      • startTaskDelayed

        public static java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> startTaskDelayed(java.lang.Runnable run,
                                                                       long delay)
        Start any Runnable task after a wait time in a worker pool thread. The returned ScheduledFuture allows to inspect, cancel or join the task before its scheduled start time occurred.
        Parameters:
        run - Runnable task
        delay - long wait time in milliseconds from now
        Returns:
        ScheduledFuture task handle

      • startTaskDelayed

        public static java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> startTaskDelayed(java.util.concurrent.Callable<?> callable,
                                                                       long delay)
        Start any Callable task after a wait time in a worker pool thread. The returned ScheduledFuture allows to inspect, cancel or join the task before its scheduled start time occurred.
        Parameters:
        run - Callable task
        delay - long wait time in milliseconds from now
        Returns:
        ScheduledFuture task handle

      • startTaskPeriodic

        public static java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> startTaskPeriodic(java.lang.Runnable run,
                                                                        long delay)
        Start any Runnable task in a worker pool thread after a wait time and continued periodically thereafter. The returned ScheduledFuture allows to inspect, cancel or join the task.

        The "join" will only return after the task is cancelled.

        Parameters:
        run - Runnable task
        delay - long delay time between task executions in milliseconds
        Returns:
        ScheduledFuture task handle

      • invokeActionLater

        public static void invokeActionLater(java.lang.String cmd)
        Asynchronously performs the specified command action on the EDT. This method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        command - String command token of ActionRunner class

      • invokeActionNow

        public static void invokeActionNow(java.lang.String cmd)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                   java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Asynchronously performs the specified command action on the EDT and awaits its completion. This method blocks until command execution has completed.
        Parameters:
        command - String command token of ActionRunner class
        Throws:
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • performAction

        public static void performAction(java.lang.String command)
        Synchronously performs the specified command action in the calling thread.

        Note: this can cause problems if the called command performs GUI activity since it may not be guaranteed they are performed on EDT!

        Parameters:
        command - String command token of ActionRunner class

      • executeOnEDT

        public static void executeOnEDT(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Ensures the parameter executable block is run on the AWT Event Dispatching Thread. If the current thread is an AWT Event Dispatching Thread, the block is called directly without transferring it via "SwingUtilities.invokeLater".
        Parameters:
        r - Runnable code block to execute

      • executeOnEDT_Wait

        public static void executeOnEDT_Wait(java.lang.Runnable r)
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                     java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Ensures the parameter executable block is run on the AWT Event Dispatching Thread. If the current thread is an AWT Event Dispatching Thread, the block is called directly, otherwise it is loaded via "SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait". This command blocks until r has been run and then continues.
        Parameters:
        r - Runnable code block to execute
        Throws:
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getAction

        public static javax.swing.Action getAction(java.lang.String name)
        Renders a basic Action performable by this handler in return to a name. Currently available names: "DELETE" (menu.edit.delete), "SAVEALL" (menu.file.saveall), "CLEARCLIP" (menu.edit.clearclip), "CLOSEALL" (menu.file.closeall) and "EDIT_ENTRY" (menu.edit.psw.edit).
        Parameters:
        name - Action name
        Returns:
        Action
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • getStartBrowserAction

        public static javax.swing.Action getStartBrowserAction(java.net.URL url,
                                                       boolean originalName)
        Returns an Action to start the application's Internet browser with the given URL parameter.
        Parameters:
        url - URL the net address to start browsing
        Returns:
        Action
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getStartEmailAction

        public static javax.swing.Action getStartEmailAction(java.lang.String address,
                                                     boolean originalName)
        Returns an Action to start the operating system's standard email client with the given address parameter.
        Parameters:
        address - String the email address to start writing to
        Returns:
        Action
        Since:
        0-6-0
